definitions.definition: The condition of failing to meet an obligation.
examples: He failed to make payments on time, and he is now in default .
You may cure this default by paying the full amount within a week.

definitions.definition: The condition of being an obligation that has not been met.
examples: The deadline has passed, so the debt is now in default .

definitions.definition: the original software programming settings as set by the factory
A loss incurred by failing to compete.
examples: The team's three losses include one default .

definitions.definition: A selection made in the absence of an alternative.
examples: The man became the leader of the group as a default .

definitions.definition: A value used when none has been given; a tentative value or standard that is presumed.
examples: If you don't specify a number of items, the default is 1.

definitions.definition: The failure of a defendant to appear and answer a summons and complaint .
A failing or failure; omission of that which ought to be done; neglect to do what duty or law requires.
examples: This evil has happened through the governor's default .

main_definition: ( finance ) The condition of failing to meet an obligation.
secondary_definitions: ( finance ) The condition of being an obligation that has not been met.
( electronics , computing ) the original software programming settings as set by the factory
A loss incurred by failing to compete.
A selection made in the absence of an alternative.
( often attributive ) A value used when none has been given; a tentative value or standard that is presumed.
( law ) The failure of a defendant to appear and answer a summons and complaint .
( obsolete ) A failing or failure; omission of that which ought to be done; neglect to do what duty or law requires.
